items.sentence: I gave you an extra hour and you still didn\'t finish the job.
I guess it\'s impossible for me to learn how to play the oboe.
I have no time for that, and besides, I don\'t have any money.
I have a cat and a dog. The cat is black and the dog is white.
Three months before Tom was to graduate from college, he died.
Tom drops his kids off at school on his way to work every day.
Tom told Mary that he wasn\'t planning to go swimming with us.
My New Year\'s resolution is to learn how to play the ocarina.
French isn\'t as hard to learn as a lot of people think it is.
Tom is in college, but his girlfriend is still in high school.
Tom is only going to tell you what he thinks you want to hear.
My weight now is the same as it was when I was in high school.
One hundred dollars will cover all your expenses for the trip.
The escaped prisoner is considered an extremely dangerous man.
The only thing that matters to Tom is how much money he makes.
There are no special rules about what clothes we have to wear.
There have been a lot of complaints about the way Tom behaves.
I have a cat and a dog. The cat\'s black and the dog\'s white.
Can we really learn to speak a foreign language like a native?
Could you please tell me again what school you graduated from?
Tom had no other choice but to help Mary clean out the garage.
Tom has been living in Boston since he graduated from college.
If you have a fever, you should go to the hospital right away.
Tom said that he didn\'t have time to answer all my questions.
Tom said that he doesn\'t care what other people think of him.
I considered changing my job, but in the end I decided not to.
I could kick myself for not inviting Tom and Mary to my party.
Were you planning to do something special for Tom\'s birthday?
I\'d like to know how Tom got a hold of our private documents.
I\'d like to read the newspaper as soon as you finish with it.
I\'d like to visit Boston at least one more time before I die.
I\'ve made an appointment to see the doctor on Monday at 2:30.
If I had 25% more income, I\'d be more satisfied with my life.
Tom managed to make time to visit Mary while he was in Boston.
Tom pays Mary three hundred dollars a week to clean his house.
Tom peeped in the window and saw that Mary was still sleeping.
Tom plans to get married as soon as he graduates from college.
Tom poured two glasses of orange juice and handed one to Mary.
You\'d be amazed how many times I\'ve told Tom not to do that.
According to Tom\'s will, Mary will inherit his entire estate.
My grandfather on my mother\'s side passed away ten years ago.
Tom told Mary to be sure to have dinner ready at six o\'clock.
Tom wanted to kiss Mary, but he didn\'t have the nerve to try.
I don\'t think Tom will be able to walk for two or three days.
I don\'t think Tom would be willing to show me how to do that.
I don\'t think traveling by train is as safe as it used to be.
I don\'t want there to be any chance of our missing the train.
I don\'t want you driving all the way from Boston by yourself.
Let\'s have one more drink, and then I\'ll take you back home.
Tom is working on something that needs to be finished by 2:30.
